properties.areaDesc: Potomac/Seeley Lake Region; Lower Clark Fork Region
properties.headline: Wind Advisory issued January 3 at 8:21AM MST until January 4 at 11:00PM MST by NWS Missoula MT
properties.description:
* WHAT...West winds 35 to 45 mph with gusts up to 55 mph
expected. Winds in high terrain will be in excess of 70 mph or
higher at times.

* WHERE...Evaro Hill, Highway 200 Thompson Falls to Plains,
Highway 200 Trout Creek to Heron, I-90 Lookout Pass to Haugan,
Highway 200 Bonner to Greenough, Highway 83 Seeley Lake to
Condon, and I-90 East Missoula to Bearmouth.

* SNOW: Snow showers will combine with gusty winds to create
periods of low visibility. Backcountry conditions may become
dangerous.

* WHEN...From 8 AM to 11 PM MST Saturday.

* IMPACTS...Gusty winds could blow around unsecured objects.
Tree limbs could be blown down and a few power outages may
result.
properties.instruction:
Use extra caution when driving, especially if operating a high
profile vehicle. Secure outdoor objects.

NWSheadline: WIND ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 8 AM TO 11 PM MST SATURDAY
